Xml Comment - <c> Gives you a way to ind.description: Xml Comment - <c> Gives you a way to indicate that text within a description should be marked as code

Xml Comment - <code> Gives you a way to.description: Xml Comment - <code> Gives you a way to indicate multiple lines as code. Use <c> to indicate that text within a description should be marked as code

Xml Comment - <example> Lets you specify.description: Xml Comment - <example> Lets you specify an example of how to use a method or other library member

Xml Comment - <exception> Lets you speci.description: Xml Comment - <exception> Lets you specify which exceptions can be thrown

Xml Comment - <include> Lets you refer t.description: Xml Comment - <include> Lets you refer to comments in another file that describe the types and members in your source code

Xml Comment - <list> A list or table can.description: Xml Comment - <list> A list or table can have as many <item> blocks as needed

Xml Comment - <para> Is for use inside a.description: Xml Comment - <para> Is for use inside a tag, such as <summary>, <remarks>, or <returns>, and lets you add structure to the text

Xml Comment - <param> Should be used in.description: Xml Comment - <param> Should be used in the comment for a method declaration to describe one of the parameters for the method

Xml Comment - <paramref> Gives you a way.description: Xml Comment - <paramref> Gives you a way to indicate that a word in the code comments, for example in a <summary> or <remarks> block refers to a parameter

Xml Comment - <permission> Lets you docu.description: Xml Comment - <permission> Lets you document the access of a member

Xml Comment - <remarks> Is used to add i.description: Xml Comment - <remarks> Is used to add information about a type, supplementing the information specified with <summary>

Xml Comment - <returns> Should be used i.description: Xml Comment - <returns> Should be used in the comment for a method declaration to describe the return value

Xml Comment - <see> Lets you specify a l.description: Xml Comment - <see> Lets you specify a link from within text. Use <seealso> to indicate that text should be placed in a See Also section

Xml Comment - <seealso> Lets you specify.description: Xml Comment - <seealso> Lets you specify the text that you might want to appear in a See Also section

Xml Comment - <summary> Should be used t.description: Xml Comment - <summary> Should be used to describe a type or a type member

Xml Comment - <typeparam> Should be used.description: Xml Comment - <typeparam> Should be used in the comment for a generic type or method declaration to describe a type parameter

Xml Comment - <typeparamref> Enable cons.description: Xml Comment - <typeparamref> Enable consumers of the documentation file to format the word in some distinct way, for example in italics

Xml Comment - <value> Lets you describe.description: Xml Comment - <value> Lets you describe the value that a property represents
